summary: An email from Brenda Smith making wide-ranging allegations connecting political figures (Clinton, Obama, Biden) and their lawyers to a conspiracy regarding health dangers from NCR paper, and threatening to release evidence of Bill Clinton's alleged sexual abuse of underage girls if demands for payment and resolution are not met. The document appears to be an extortion attempt.

persons.name: Brenda Smith
persons.role: Author of email, making allegations and demands
persons.context: Author of the email making wide-ranging allegations about a conspiracy involving NCR paper and threatening to release information about Bill Clinton's alleged sexual abuse of underage girls unless financial and other demands are met.

persons.name: David Kendall
persons.role: Lawyer for Hillary Clinton and her campaign
persons.context: Identified as a lawyer for Hillary Clinton and her campaign, listed among those alleged to have conspired regarding NCR paper.

persons.name: Marc Elias
persons.context: Listed with an email address, implied to be a lawyer associated with the alleged NCR paper conspiracy.

persons.name: Craig Silliman
persons.context: Identified as the General Counsel of Verizon, listed among those alleged to have conspired regarding NCR paper.

persons.name: Rodney Slater
persons.context: Identified as a director of Verizon, listed among those associated with the alleged NCR paper conspiracy.

persons.name: Bill Clinton
persons.role: Former U.S. President, subject of abuse allegations
persons.context: Alleged to be in jeopardy of lawsuits and criminal charges for association with and claims of sexual abuse of underage girls on many occasions. The email threatens to release evidence of this.

persons.name: Hillary Clinton
persons.role: Former U.S. Secretary of State, 2016 presidential candidate
persons.context: Alleged, along with Bill Clinton and others, to have conspired to put people in danger from NCR paper. Implicitly connected to the abuse allegations against Bill.

persons.name: Barack Obama
persons.context: Mentioned as someone whose General Counsel (Dana Remus) is associated with the alleged NCR paper conspiracy, and who could face bankruptcy from the fallout.

persons.name: Joe Biden
persons.context: Mentioned as someone whose General Counsel (Dana Remus) is associated with the alleged NCR paper conspiracy, and who could face bankruptcy from the fallout.

persons.name: Dana Remus
persons.role: General Counsel for Obama and Biden
persons.context: Identified as General Counsel for Obama and Biden, listed among those alleged to have conspired regarding NCR paper.

connections.description: Brenda Smith claims to have evidence of Bill Clinton's sexual abuse of underage girls and threatens to release it.
Brenda Smith alleges Hillary Clinton conspired regarding NCR paper and is connected to the abuse allegations against Bill.
David Kendall is identified as the lawyer for Hillary Clinton and her campaign.
Dana Remus is identified as General Counsel for Obama and Biden.
Dana Remus is identified as General Counsel for Obama and Biden.
Both are associated with Verizon (General Counsel and Director) and are named together in the alleged NCR paper conspiracy.
Referred to together as subjects of the allegations regarding NCR paper and abuse.

events.title: Email Threat and Extortion Demand
events.description: Brenda Smith sends an email alleging a vast conspiracy involving NCR paper and threatening to release evidence of Bill Clinton's alleged sexual abuse of underage girls unless a $50,000 deposit is made and a contract is agreed upon by the following Friday.

events.title: Prior Email Communication
events.description: A prior email from Brenda Smith was sent, referenced in the current email (EFTA00095919).

keyFacts: The email contains an explicit threat to release evidence alleging Bill Clinton's sexual abuse of underage girls unless financial and contractual demands are met.
The author, Brenda Smith, alleges a vast conspiracy involving Democratic Party figures (Clinton, Obama, Biden), their lawyers, Verizon, and unions to conceal health dangers from NCR paper.
The document appears to be an attempt at extortion, demanding a $50,000 deposit and a resolution contract to avoid massive lawsuits and public exposure.
The email references 'hundreds of emails' as purported evidence for both the NCR paper conspiracy and the Clinton abuse allegations.
The threats are directed at causing financial ruin, loss of law licenses, and the end of the Democratic Party.
